result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Terrell Vdille was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, any bail to apply, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay

No contact with firearms.
Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.

No contact with victim unless approved by court or agent, except for third party contact if approved by agent.
No violent contact with J.T.V. (8/28/06) or J.T.V. (7/30/13).
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Batterers Intervention program.
Parenting classes.
Family Therapy with J.T.V. (8/28/06) or J.T.V (7/30/13), if approved by victim.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Terrell Vdille

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason Terrell Vdille in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  
cab
Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Jason Terrell Vdille in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded. Court reviewed and returned photographs to the state.Received & Filed, Letter on behalf of defendant. Statements by parties and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 150 DAYS as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim unless approved by court or agent, except for third party contact if approved by agent. 
-No violent contact with J.T.V. (8/28/06) or J.T.V. (7/30/13).
-Family Therapy with J.T.V. (8/28/06) or J.T.V. (7/30/13), if approved by victim.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, any bail to apply, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant allowed to have contact with JTV (dob 08/28/06) and JTV (dob 07/30/13).

BRANCH 10 FOR BRANCH 23.  Defendant Jason Terrell Vdille in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire/Addendum received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to  defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment be entered on the record.  Defendant is advised he may not possess any firearms.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 23.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jason Terrell Vdille in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests a Plea Hearing. Court granted. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23. Plea Hearing set for April 9, 2015 at 8:30am.

Defendant Jason Terrell Vdille in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Status Conference. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Nikita, JTV, or JTV.

Defendant Jason Terrell Vdille in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Flanagan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grady, Br. 23.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/5/15 @ 1:30pm
